intro: Mezilaurus crassiramea, commonly known as the rough-leaved mezilaurus, is a member of the Rutaceae family, characterized by its distinctive foliage and floral structure. It is native to South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and full sun conditions. The plant features dark green, leathery leaves with a rough texture, and its small, fragrant flowers are typically white or pale yellow. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to tolerate dry environments. Mezilaurus crassiramea is also valued for its resilience and low maintenance requirements in landscaping.
